Title: FTS Query - Operators
DescriptionLines: **Full Text Search query** allows searching for documents containing particular term(s) within a block of text.
**You can customize the logical operators** between the searched terms.
Upon query, an auto-index is created on the searched document fields.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on the 'Employees' collection Using the Session `query()`.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define search criteria I
DescriptionLines: * Use `search()` to search for the specified terms on the specified document field.
* The default operator between 'term1' and 'term2' is OR.
Use `SearchOperator.AND` to set the logical AND operation instead.
* In this Search, we search for _term1 AND term2_ in the document field _Notes_.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define search criteria II
DescriptionLines: * Another `search()` method can be called for searching on another document field or terms.
* The specified logical operation is applied between this 'search' and the previous 'search'.
* With this Search added, we are now searching for ( _term1_ AND _term2_ ) OR _term3_ in the document field _Notes_.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: An Auto-Index is created upon executing the query for the first time with 2 index fields:
* _Notes_ - contains the original text from the indexed document field Notes.
* _search(Notes)_ - contains terms from the Notes field that were tokenized by RavenDB's default analyzer (RavenStandardAnalyzer).
If your text needs to be tokenized with a different analyzer, then you need to use a static index instead of a dynamic query.
* Variable 'employees_with_matching_terms' will hold the matching document entities.
Results will include only Employees documents containing either ('term1' and 'term2') or 'term3'.
